title: What would happen to the living organisms on the earth if the atmosphere were to disappear? - Quora

response.answer_text: I saw this on “Space Balls” the movie. Space Ball one turned into a giant transformer “MegaMaid” and used her giant vacuum cleaner to suck all the air from Druidia once the air shield was turned off. The trees and snow were sucked right up and Jerry van Dyke put his head down on his desk and passed out. If Lonestar hadn't used his “Schwartz” powers to flip the switch on “MegaMaid” to reverse, they all would have died! Now…Seriously, did you really need to waste everyone's time with such a silly question. A few hardy spores might last a while but every thing else would die. Any event cataclysmic enough to cause use to lose our atmosphere, would likely wipe out all life anyway. Please try and formulate questions that really require “answers” in the future.

Then tardigrades stick 6 middle fingers up at every other carbon based life form on the planet because they’re still alive. Those jerk offs can survive in space and supposedly atmospheric entry on a meteorite. Everything else dies though.
Everyone Dies™ That was easy. If there is no atmosphere, then there is no oxygen. Without oxygen, nothing can breathe. Also, plants die too, because they need the CO2 in the air.
A lot of gasping for breath.
